item.value: The banana tree is not actually a tree, it is a herb. It bears fruit once a year and then dies.
The heaviest apple weighed 1.849 kg (4 lb 1 oz) and was grown and picked by Chisato Iwasaki at his apple farm in Hirosaki City, Japan October 24, 2005.
Mount McKinley in Alaska in the highest mountain in America. It is 20,320 ft high.
The Chinese invented eyeglasses. Marco Polo reported seeing many pairs worn by the Chinese as early as 1275, 500 years before lens griding became an art in the West.
New York is the city with the biggest population in America. It has over 8.3 million inhabitants.
There are 206 bones in the adult human body and are 300 in children. As children age some bones fuse together.

In 1972 Ray Tomlinson at BBN developed the first e-mail program. In his first email to himself, he uses the @ sign. This was the first time it appeared in an e-mail address.
